intro: Podospermum hieracioides var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf podospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its compact growth habit and delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ability to tolerate various environmental conditions.
